ago.name: ago
ago.description: Specify a timestamp in the past relative to the current time

years.description: How many years to subtract from the current time

months.name: months
months.description: How many months to subtract from the current time

days.description: How many days to subtract from the current time

hours.description: How many hours to subtract from the current time

minutes.description: How many minutes to subtract from the current time

seconds.name: seconds
seconds.description: How many seconds to subtract from the current time

in.name: in
in.description: Specify a timestamp in the future relative to the current time

years.name: years
years.description: How many years to add to the current time

months.name: months
months.description: How many months to add to the current time

days.name: days
days.description: How many days to add to the current time

hours.name: hours
hours.description: How many hours to add to the current time

minutes.name: minutes
minutes.description: How many minutes to add to the current time

seconds.name: seconds

at.name: at
at.description: Specify the exact components of the timestamp (including the timezone)

year.name: year
year.description: Specify the year (defaults to current year)

month.name: month
month.description: Specify the month (defaults to current month)

day.name: day
day.description: Specify the day (defaults to current day)

hour.name: hour
hour.description: Specify the hour (defaults to current hour)

hour12.name: hour12
hour12.description: Specify the hour using 12-hour clock (defaults to current hour)

minute.name: minute
minute.description: Specify the minute (defaults to current minute)

am.name: am
am.description: When True, hour must be between 1 to 12 and will be interpreted as AM (ante meridiem)

pm.name: pm
pm.description: When True, hour must be between 1 to 12 and will be interpreted as PM (post meridiem)

responses.amOrPmOnly: You can't specify both am and pm options
responses.meridiemRequired: You must provide either the am or pm option when using the hour12 option
responses.noAmOrPmWithMeridiem: You can't specify the am or pm options when the meridiem in provided in the hour parameter
responses.hourOrHour12Only: You can't specify both hour and hour12 options
responses.hourRange: When a meridiem is not specified, hour must be a number between 0 and 23
responses.hour12Range: When a meridiem is specified, hour must be a number between 1 and 12

add.description: Add some time to the specified UNIX timestamp

unix.name: unix
unix.description: Display the syntaxes for a specific UNIX timestamp

responses.invalidDate: The specified date is invalid (for example: the given day does not exist)
responses.noComponentsCurrentTime: You must specify at least one time component to change. If you need the current time, use `/{{atCommand}}` without specifying any arguments
responses.noComponentsUnix: You must specify at least one time component to change. If you want to get the syntax for a UNIX timestamp, use `/{{unixCommand}}`
responses.timezoneNotFound: The specified timezone cannot be found
responses.unexpectedError: There was an unexpected error while processing this interaction

format.name: format
format.description: Returns only the specified format in the response

columns.name: columns
columns.description: Specify which columns to display in the returned response

ephemeral.name: ephemeral
ephemeral.description: When true the response will only be visible to you

header.name: header
header.description: Display the initial time (as interpreted by the bot) on top of the response

components.replyWithSpecificFormat: Select a format below to receive it in a reply (for copying on touch devices)
components.telemetryThankYou: Thank you for contributing telemetry data, which helps the bot's future development. See the {{privacyPolicy}} for details.
components.telemetryInfoCount: This is execution #{{executionNumber}} for the {{command}} command (since we started counting).
components.recordingTelemetry: Telemetry is being collected for this command, results are pendingâ€¦
components.telemetryPlaceholder: The rest of this text is only here to prevent the message size from changing too much when the results of the telemetry recording are available.
components.at12Hint: There are now several different options to specify the number of hours both within the {{slashAt}} command (via the existing {{hourOptionName}} option which now has autocompletion, or the new {{hour12OptionName}}, {{amOptionName}} and {{pmOptionName}} options) and the new {{slashAt12}} command. Use whichever you are more comfortable with. How popular each method is (based on the telemetry data) will determine which of these options will become permanent.

statistics.name: statistics
statistics.description: Displays various information about the bot

responses.noShards: (The bot is not currently using sharding)

snowflake.description: Display the syntax for the timestamp of a Snowflake (most IDs within Discord)

responses.targetMessage: Send timestamp for the following message: {{url}}
Last edit timestamp for the following message: {{url}}
responses.notEdited: This message has not been edited yet

iso.name: iso
iso.description: Display the syntaxes for a specific ISO 8601 timestamp

responses.invalidIsoFormat: The provided value does not match the ISO 8601 standard

responses.targetMessage: All timestamps found in the following message: {{url}}
responses.noTimestamps: This message does not contain any timestamps in Discord's format

settings.name: settings
settings.description: Create a link to manage your settings via the website

responses.linkCreated:
Please visit the link below to be logged into the bot's website automatically in order to change your settings.
<{{magicLink}}>
This link will expire {{expiresAt}} but you can always run this command to generate a new link, or visit <{{loginUrl}}> to log in manually, then go to <{{settingsUrl}}> to change your settings.
responses.failedToCreateLink: Could not generate a link to log you in automatically, please visit <{{loginUrl}}> and log in manually, then go to <{{settingsUrl}}> to change your settings.

at12.name: at12
at12.description: Specify the exact components of the timestamp (using a 12-hour clock)

responses.amOrPmOnly: You can't specify both am and pm options
responses.meridiemRequired: You must provide either the am or pm option

year.name: year
year.description: Specify the year (defaults to current year)

month.name: month
month.description: Specify the month (defaults to current month)

day.name: day
day.description: Specify the day (defaults to current day)

hour.name: hour
hour.description: Specify the hour (defaults to current hour)

minute.name: minute
minute.description: Specify the minute (defaults to current minute)

am.name: am
am.description: When True, hour will be interpreted as am (ante meridiem, before noon)

pm.name: pm
pm.description: When True, hour will be interpreted as pm (post meridiem, after noon)
